dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/1667434913 at Mon Oct 11 09:20:40 UTC 2021

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: registry Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

panels.title: registry Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.content:
### Description

Measures aggregated HTTP request traffic through the HAProxy.
5xx responses are considered to be failures.

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of all registry requests.



### Observability Tools

* [GKE Deployment: gitlab-registry](https://console.cloud.google.com/kubernetes/deployment/us-east1/gprd-gitlab-gke/gitlab/gitlab-registry/overview?project=gitlab-production)
* [Stackdriver Logs: GKE Container Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=labels%2E%22k8s%2Dpod%2Ftype%22%3D%22registry%22%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Ecluster%5Fname%3D%22gprd%2Dgitlab%2Dgke%22%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Econtainer%5Fname%3D%22registry%22%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Enamespace%5Fname%3D%22gitlab%22%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Eproject%5Fid%3D%22gitlab%2Dproduction%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22k8s%5Fcontainer%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)
* [üìñ Kibana: Registry logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.remote_ip,json.duration_ms,json.code,json.msg,json.status,json.error,json.method,json.uri),filters:!((query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:registry,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:registry,type:phrase))))),index:'97ce8e90-63ad-11ea-8617-2347010d3aab')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

* [üìñ Kibana: Registry failed request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.remote_ip,json.duration_ms,json.code,json.msg,json.status,json.error,json.method,json.uri),filters:!((query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:registry,type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(query:(match:(json.type:(query:registry,type:phrase)))),(query:(range:(json.status:(gte:500))))),index:'97ce8e90-63ad-11ea-8617-2347010d3aab')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

panels.title: Details

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: server_route_manifest_reads SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="server_route_manifest_reads",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="server_route_manifest_reads",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="server_route_manifest_reads",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="server_route_manifest_reads",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="server_route_manifest_reads",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: server_route_manifest_reads SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

All read-requests (HEAD or GET) for the manifest endpoints on
the registry.
Fetch the manifest identified by name and reference where reference can be
a tag or digest. A HEAD request can also be issued to this endpoint to
obtain resource information without receiving all data.

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="server_route_manifest_writes",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="server_route_manifest_writes",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="server_route_manifest_writes",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="server_route_manifest_writes",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="server_route_manifest_writes",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="registry"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="registry"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: server_route_manifest_writes SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

All write-requests (put, delete) for the manifest endpoints on
the registry.

Put the manifest identified by name and reference where reference can be
a tag or digest.

Delete the manifest identified by name and reference. Note that a manifest
can only be deleted by digest.

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better
panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service
panels.title: Node Network Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Write IO operations per second. Lower is better.

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.

panels.description: Disk Write throughput datarate. Lower is better.

panels.title: Disk Read Total Time

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

panels.description: CPU scheduling waiting on the run queue, as a percentage of time. Aggregated to worst CPU per node. Lower is better.
panels.title: CPU Scheduling Waiting

panels.description: Loadavg (1 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load1{{"env": "$environment", "environment": "$environment", "stage": "$stage", "type": "registry"}})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", {"env": "$environment", "environment": "$environment", "stage": "$stage", "type": "registry"}})

panels.title: loadavg1 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (5 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load5{{"env": "$environment", "environment": "$environment", "stage": "$stage", "type": "registry"}})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", {"env": "$environment", "environment": "$environment", "stage": "$stage", "type": "registry"}})

panels.title: loadavg5 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (15 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load15{{"env": "$environment", "environment": "$environment", "stage": "$stage", "type": "registry"}})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", {"env": "$environment", "environment": "$environment", "stage": "$stage", "type": "registry"}})

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.description: Network utilization
panels.title: registry Deployment: Network IO

panels.description:
Ratio of requested CPU resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by memory requests already.
panels.title: Node CPU Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Ratio of requested Memory resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by CPU requests already.
panels.title: Node Memory Requests Utilization

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_inodes component saturation: Disk inode Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Disk space utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - instance:node_filesystem_avail:ratio{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", fqdn!="", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Space Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Go's memory allocation strategy can make it look like a Go process is saturating memory when measured using RSS, when in fact
the process is not at risk of memory saturation. For this reason, we measure Go processes using the `go_memstat_alloc_bytes`
metric instead of RSS.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
        go_memstats_alloc_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}
      )
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
        node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total memory utilization for containers for this service, as a percentage of
the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
Measures Go memory usage as a percentage of container memory limit
 Lower is better.
panels.title: kube_go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
The HPA is the [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/).
It automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The HPA has a configured upper maximum. When this limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and
other resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, hpa, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_hpa_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|memory-bound|urgent-other"}
      /
      kube_hpa_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|memory-bound|urgent-other"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_hpa_desired_replicas component saturation: HPA Desired Replicas

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in the node pool for
a service fleet.

If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total:labeled{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_pool_cpu component saturation: Average Node Pool CPU Utilization

panels.description:
A GKE kubernetes node pool is close to it's maximum number of nodes.

The maximum is defined in terraform, via the `max_node_count` field of a node pool. The limit is per-zone, so for
single zone clusters the number of nodes will match the limit, for regional clusters, the limit is multiplied by
the number of zones the cluster is deployed over.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, cluster, label_pool, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      count by (cluster, env, environment, label_pool, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        kube_node_labels:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}
      )
      / on(cluster, env, environment, label_pool) group_left() (
        label_replace(
          terraform_report_google_cluster_node_pool_max_node_count,
          "label_pool", "$0", "pool_name", ".*"
        )
        * on(cluster, env, environment) group_left()
        count by (cluster, env, environment) (
          group by (cluster, env, environment, label_topology_kubernetes_io_zone) (
            kube_node_labels:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}
          )
        )
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_pool_max_nodes component saturation: Kube Pool Max Node Limit

panels.description:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{fqdn!="", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Measures the amount of scheduler waiting time that processes are waiting
to be scheduled, according to [`CPU Scheduling Metrics`](https://www.robustperception.io/cpu-scheduling-metrics-from-the-node-exporter).

A high value indicates that a node has more processes to be run than CPU time available
to handle them, and may lead to degraded responsiveness and performance from the application.

Additionally, it may indicate that the fleet is under-provisioned.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without (cpu) (rate(node_schedstat_waiting_seconds_total{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}[1h]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: node_schedstat_waiting component saturation: Node Scheduler Waiting Time

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{fqdn!="", mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="registry"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node
